description: Excavation of existing basement to increase floor-to-ceiling height
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>All new external facing materials, including windows, in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.<br></p><p><br></p><p>

REASON: To ensure the proposed development appears appropriate in regard to design and does not detract from the charcater or appearance of Northwold &amp; Cazenove Conservation Area.<br></p>

<p>No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a report (including intrusive investigation/trial pit
and monitoring where necessary) demonstrating that the basement development will not increase the potential for
groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for
approval. Details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures against surface water
(overland flow) and groundwater (if identified) shall be submitted to the LPA for approval and the approved measures
incorporated before the basement is occupied. The basement shall be constructed and completed in accordance with
the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of below ground structures against water
from the ground" and current best practice.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To mitigate against the effects of surface water flooding.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
